full_text:
Configuring Permissions

Lesson
objectives

* Create system permissions

¢ Write Gosu expressions that evaluate user
permissions

¢ Use application permission keys

Permissions, Roles, and Access Control
Lists

| Permissions

¢ Apermission allows a user to do one of the following:
* View or navigate to an object
* Create, edit, or delete an object
* Own an object
* Act on an object

¢ For purposes of permissions, “an object’ is either:
« A database object such as a claim or an activity, or
« Auser interface (Ul) component such as a location or a button

¢ Permissions are defined by the
SystemPermissionType typelist

* You can add custom permissions to this list

¢ Are not assigned directly to users

es

View claims

Edit claims

Own claims

Co)
I

Create claim

Fo

Print claims

5e

Close claims

| Roles Gi

¢ Are named collections of permissions that define a job’s tasks
* Arole typically maps to a job title or function
¢ Are assigned directly to individual users

Ax Ams

Ida Belt Andy Applegate Rick Ralston

© @
e Gm

j aa

r

—S FA AK

| Two ways of organizing tasks into roles Gi

Suppose Adjusters have all the permissions of customer service representatives
(CSR), as well as several more.

e e ©
Create complete separate sets of Create roles with unique sets of

permissions for each role permissions

Each user has exactly one role Each user has as many roles as needed

| Access control lists (ACLs)

¢ Are lists associated with claims
¢ Identify the users who may access the claim

¢ Ensure that only users with a “need” can view or edit a claim

Shy < > a
Bes 0 Oe QO —s
Claim Access

# 100-00-100001 Control List

| Permissions and ACLs Gi

To view a claim, a user must have the correct permissions AND be on the Access
Control List for that claim.

| Application permission keys (APKs) fa

« An application permission key (APK) is a system-defined group of SS
one or more permissions plus additional logic SS

* Groups permissions according to entities and business processes
¢ Every APK is associated with a single entity Claim Edit
* Cannot be created or modified
¢ Appears in the files used to specify the user interface

Page
¥ Basic properties
canEdit false

canVisit perm.Claim.view(Claim)] and perm.System.viewworkplan
id* ClaimWorkplan Claim View

title* DisplayKey. get ("Web.Claim.ClaimWorkplan")

| Static and object-based permissions

¢ Static permissions are granted or
denied across the entire application

* Object-based permissions are
granted or denied on a claim-by-claim
basis

* These permissions are ACL related

| Demonstration G
Permission in the base application

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,~- — Whatis the difference between a static permission and an object-based

Pa permission?
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Gi

Answer

,— — Whatis the difference between a static permission and an object-based
Pa permission?
4

The correct answer is:
Astatic permission is granted or revoked for the entire application.

An object-based permission is granted on a claim by claim (or exposure by exposure)
basis.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Gi

Question

,- — Whatis the difference between a permission and an application

Pa permission key (APK) containing only one permission?
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer Gi

,— — Whatis the difference between a permission and an application

Pa permission key (APK) containing only one permission?
¢

Possible answers:
* Apermission can be created by a Guidewire configurator, while an APK cannot.
* Apermission can be added to a role, while an APK cannot.

* Apermissions check using an APK will execute faster than a permissions check
which directly references a permission.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Question G

_— — Whatis the difference between an APK with two permissions (such as
Pa “create note” and “edit note”) and a role with the same two pennissions?

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer Gi

_— — Whatis the difference between an APK with two permissions (such as
: “create note” and “edit note”) and a role with the same two pernissions?

¢
¢

Possible answers:

An APK is created to optimize permissions checks. A role is created to assign
permissions to users.

Developers can create and modify roles. Developers cannot create or modify APKs.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Security Dictionary

| Review: Security dictionary fa

* Series of HTML pages that document permissions and roles in your application
¢ Four main sections
¢ Application permission keys

* Pages (in the user interface)
+ System permissions Application Permission Keys

Pages Activity approve
+ Roles System Permissions based)

Roles > Description

Summary

Related Permissions

a
Actiuity-appiove approve actapproveany
Activity approveany Permission to approve any appro

Activity assign even if the activity is assigned to

| Security dictionary: APKs Gi

¢ Lists all APKs
¢ Displays permissions associated with each APK

Activity assign AuthorityLimit create{(siaic)]

> Description > Description
Related Permissions Related Permissions

usergrantauth
Permission to grant or change an authority limit for a user

actraown
Permission to reassign your own activities

actraunown
Permission to reassign activities owned by other users

| Security dictionary: Pages fa

¢ Lists all pages
¢ Displays visit and edit permission expressions associated with each page

AccountDetail

> Description

Visit Permission Expression:
perm. System.accountmng

Edit Permission Expression:
perm.System.accountmng

| Security dictionary: System permissions Gi

¢ Lists all permissions

¢ Displays roles, APKs, pages, and elements associated with each permission

Roles

Related Elements

UserStatisticsDV (UserStatisticsDV.pcf)

| Security dictionary: Roles Gi

¢ Lists all roles
¢ Displays permissions assigned to each role

AdminData.Role.Name.Adjuster

> Description

Permissions

abview
Permission to view the details of contact entries in the address book

abviewsearch
Permission to search contact entries in the address book

actcreate
Permission to create new activities

actcreateclsd
Permission to create a new activity associated with a closed claim

Creating the Security Dictionary at the command line

1. Navigate to the ClaimCenter root directory
2. Run the command gwb genDataDictionary

* Creates the data dictionary at<ClaimCenter
root>/build/dictionary/security asa set of HTML files

1H Administrator: C\windows\system32\cmd.exe - gwb genDataDictionary oS

daemon will be stopped at the end of the build stopping after ¢
parallel execution is an incubating feature.

> Configur e pr oject

Build s an incubating feature.

> Task :modules ‘on Figur: ‘ation: genEntitySources
r module a on"
entities(s) 90 typelist(s)

| Creating the Security Dictionary from the UI Gi

1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Export Data

2. Under Export Security Dictionary, select whether to export as HTML or XML
3. Click Export

* Creates the Security Dictionary as a downloadable ZIP file
+ Useful when the user administrator changes roles

Export Data

Export Administrative Data Export Security Dictionary

Output Format © @ HTML XML Export
Data to Export

Admin

| Demonstration G
Security dictionary

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_- — Ifyou need to know which roles include the claimown system

Pa permission, how would you go about this?
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer Gi

_- — !fyou need to know which roles include the claimown system
Pa permission, how would you go about this?
¢
The correct answer is on the System Permissions page of the security dictionary, look

at the roles section of the claimown system permission.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Question

_- — Howcan you generate or update the security dictionary?

7
¢
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer Gi

,— — How can you generate or update the security dictionary?
y ¢
“ The correct answers are using one of these two ways:
1. Atthe command line, navigate to the ClaimCenter root directory and enter gwb
genDataDictionary. The security dictionary is generated along with the data
dictionary.

2. On the Export Data page of the Administration tab, you may choose to generate
the security dictionary either as HTML or as XML. In either case, the file is then
downloaded as a .ZIP.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Configuring Permissions

| SystemPermissionType typelist

* System permissions are defined in the
SystemPermissionType typelist

¢ Add typecodes to create new static
permissions

* You cannot create new object-based
permissions

lement Code

| Adding permissions to the Ul Gi

¢ Select the PCF file (or component of a PCF file, such as a toolbar) where the
permission is to be applied

¢ Inthe appropriate property (such as canEdit, canVisit, visible, etc.) enter
perm. System. permissionName

¢ Returns true if the user has the listed permission

Page
¥ Basic properties
canEdit false

canVisit perm.Claim.view(Claim) and|perm.System.viewworkplan

Adding APKs to the UI Gi

¢ Select the PCF file (or component of a PCF file, such as a toolbar) where
the permission is to be applied
¢ Inthe appropriate property (such as canEdit, canVisit, etc.) enter
perm. entity. appKey fora static key
« Returns true if current user has a permission in the given key
perm. entity. appKey(object) for an object-based key
* Object must be an instance of entity
« Returns true if current user has a permission in the given key on the named object
Page
¥ Basic properties

canEdit false

canVisit perm.Claim.view(Claim)] and perm.System.viewworkplan i

| Demonstration G
Configuring permissions

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_- — Given the perm condition perm. System. applyCheck, is applycheck a
Pa system permission or an APK?
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — Given the perm condition perm. System. applyCheck, is applycheck a
Pa system permission or an APK?
¢
The correct answer is it is a system permission. If it were an APK, it would have the
entity listed at the beginning of its name.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Question

_— — Given the perm condition perm. System. applyCheck, is applycheck
Pa static or object-based?

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Gi

Answer

,- — Given the perm condition perm. System. applyCheck, is applycheck
Pa static or object-based?

The correct answer is Static. If it were object-based, it would have an (object)
argument.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Gi

review ¢ Write Gosu expressions that evaluate user
permissions
¢ Use application permission keys
